A selection of summary functions from Hmisc

Source: R/stat-summary.r
hmisc.Rd

These are wrappers around functions from Hmisc designed to make them easier to use with stat_summary(). See the Hmisc documentation for more details:

  • Hmisc::smean.cl.boot()

  • Hmisc::smean.cl.normal()

  • Hmisc::smean.sdl()

  • Hmisc::smedian.hilow()

mean_cl_boot(x, ...)

mean_cl_normal(x, ...)

mean_sdl(x, ...)

median_hilow(x, ...)

Arguments

x

a numeric vector
...

other arguments passed on to the respective Hmisc function.

Value

A data frame with columns y, ymin, and ymax.

Examples

x <- rnorm(100)
mean_cl_boot(x)
#>            y       ymin      ymax
#> 1 0.05666078 -0.1084214 0.2336644
mean_cl_normal(x)
#>            y       ymin      ymax
#> 1 0.05666078 -0.1206024 0.2339239
mean_sdl(x)
#>            y      ymin     ymax
#> 1 0.05666078 -1.730071 1.843392
median_hilow(x)
#>           y      ymin     ymax
#> 1 0.1100254 -1.569881 1.640211

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
  • Examples

ggplot2 is a part of the tidyverse, an ecosystem of packages designed with common APIs and a shared philosophy. Learn more at tidyverse.org.
